name: sass

options.description: Read the stylesheet from stdin.
Don't read the stylesheet from stdin.
Use the indented syntax for input from stdin.
Don't use the indented syntax for input from stdin.
A path to use when resolving imports. May be passed multiple times.
Output style. [expanded (default), compressed]
Emit a @charset or BOM for CSS with non-ASCII characters. (defaults to on)
Don't emit a @charset or BOM for CSS with non-ASCII characters. (defaults to on)
When an error occurs, emit a stylesheet describing it. Defaults to true when compiling to a file.
When an error occurs, don't emit a stylesheet describing it. Defaults to true when compiling to a file.
Only compile out-of-date stylesheets.
Whether to generate source maps. (defaults to on)
Whether to generate source maps. (defaults to on)
How to link from source maps to source files. [relative (default), absolute]
Embed source file contents in source maps.
Embed source file contents in source maps.
Embed source map contents in CSS.
Embed source map contents in CSS.
Don't print warnings.
Don't print warnings.
Don't print compiler warnings from dependencies. Stylesheets imported through load paths count as dependencies.
Don't print compiler warnings from dependencies. Stylesheets imported through load paths count as dependencies.
Print all deprecation warnings even when they're repetitive.
Print all deprecation warnings even when they're repetitive.
Deprecations to treat as errors. You may also pass a Sass version to include any behavior deprecated in or before it. See https://sass-lang.com/documentation/breaking-changes for a complete list.
Opt in to a deprecation early.
Watch stylesheets and recompile when they change.
Manually check for changes rather than using a native watcher. Only valid with --watch.
Manually check for changes rather than using a native watcher. Only valid with --watch.
Don't compile more files once an error is encountered.
Don't compile more files once an error is encountered.
Run an interactive SassScript shell.
Whether to use terminal colors for messages.
Whether to use terminal colors for messages.
Whether to use Unicode characters for messages.
Whether to use Unicode characters for messages.
Print full Dart stack traces for exceptions.
Print full Dart stack traces for exceptions.
Print this usage information.
Print the version of Dart Sass.

tldr:
> Converts SCSS or Sass files to CSS.
> More information: <https://sass-lang.com/documentation/cli/dart-sass>.

- Convert a SCSS or Sass file to CSS and print out the result:

`sass {{inputfile.scss|inputfile.sass}}`

- Convert a SCSS or Sass file to CSS and save the result to a file:

`sass {{inputfile.scss|inputfile.sass}} {{outputfile.css}}`

- Watch a SCSS or Sass file for changes and output or update the CSS file with same filename:

`sass --watch {{inputfile.scss|inputfile.sass}}`

- Watch a SCSS or Sass file for changes and output or update the CSS file with the given filename:

`sass --watch {{inputfile.scss|inputfile.sass}}:{{outputfile.css}}`
